title: Valles Caldera National Preserve: Preserve Entrances
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Preserve Entrances              Preserve Entrances       Valles Caldera has two entrances. Currently the preserve entrances are restricted to seasonal and daily hours of operation. Access through the Valles Caldera along NM Highway 4 is available year-round at any time. Make sure to carefully read about access at each entrance at different times of year.   Valle Grande Entrance (main entrance)  Located off NM Highway 4 near mile marker 39.2, this is the main entrance into the Valles Caldera National Preserve. Access by vehicle, hiking, biking, skiing, and snowshoeing are allowed through this entrance.    Banco Bonito Entrance  Located off NM Highway 4 near mile marker 30, this entrance provides access to trails located in the southwest corner of the preserve. Access by special use permit only for the 2016 season.    Coyote Call Trailhead  Located off NM Highway 4 near mile marker 40.8, this entrance provides access to trails located in the southeast corner of the preserve. Access by hiking, skiing, and snowshoeing only are allowed through this entrance.    Valle Grande Trailhead  Located off NM Highway 4 near mile marker 42.8, this entrance provides access to trails located in the southeast corner of the preserve. Access by hiking, skiing, and snowshoeing only are allowed through this entrance.     Click on the map to view a larger version.  Â       Map of roads, trails, and access points in Valles Caldera.
